{"step_by_step_thinking": "The yellowish-brown staining of the IOPA dental X-ray film is not due to increased exposure time, as this would result in a darker image, not a stained one. Similarly, increased temperature of the developer would speed up the development process, but it wouldn't cause staining. Drying away of the developer solution would result in an incomplete development of the film, not staining. However, if the film is immersed in fixer without washing, residual chemicals can cause a yellowish-brown stain on the film.", "answer_choice": "A"}
